title: (No. 23 of 2011)) of the Private Security Services Act 2004 (No. 12 of 2004),
heading: 1. These Regulations may be cited as the Private Security (Licensing and
text_raw:
1. These Regulations may be cited as the Private Security (Licensing and 

Qualifications) (Amendment) Regulations 2024.
text_norm: 1 regulation may cited private security (licensing qualifications) (amendment) regulation 2024

title: (No. 23 of 2011)) of the Private Security Services Act 2004 (No. 12 of 2004),
heading: 2. These Regulations come into operation on the 8th May 2024
text_raw: 2. These Regulations come into operation on the 8th May 2024

title: (No. 23 of 2011)) of the Private Security Services Act 2004 (No. 12 of 2004),
heading: 3. The Private Security (Licensing and Qualifications) Regulations 2022
text_raw:
3. The Private Security (Licensing and Qualifications) Regulations 2022 

(S.I. No. 574 of 2022) are amended – 

(a) 

in Regulation 4 by inserting the following definition: 

“’enforcement guard’ has the meaning assigned by the Act”; 

(b) 

in Regulation 5 by substituting the following paragraphs for 
paragraphs (b) and (c): 

“(b) enforcement guard licence, 

(c) 

private investigator licence, 

(d) 

security guard (guarding) licence.”; 

(c) 

in Regulation 6 by substituting the following for paragraph (a): 

“(a) Following are the qualifications to be held by the 
following categories of licensee, in so far as those 
qualifications are applicable to the licensee concerned: 

Category of licensee 

Qualification 

door supervisor 

enforcement guard 

private investigator 

security guard (guarding) 

QQI Level 4 Minor award 4N20611 – 
Door Security Skills or equivalent 

QQI Level 4 Minor award 4N22384 – 
Enforcement Guard Skills or equivalent 

PSA Training Requirements for the 
Licensing of Private 
Investigator 
Employees (PSA 83:2021) 

QQI Level 4 Minor award 4N20604 – 
Security Guarding Skills or equivalent”; 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 17th May, 2024. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 [204] 3 

(d) by substituting the following for Regulation 7: 

“7. Upon the making of these Regulations , a person holding a 
door supervisor licence or security guarding licence will 
be allowed to continue to do so until their scheduled 
renewal date. On renewal such persons will be required to 
have completed the prescribed training course and apply 
for an enforcement guard licence.”. 

The Minister for Justice consents to the making of the foregoing Regulations. 

GIVEN under the Official Seal of the Minister for Justice, 

8 May, 2024. 

HELEN MCENTEE, 
Minister for Justice. 

GIVEN under the seal of the Private Security Authority, 

8 May, 2024. 

JILLIAN VAN TURNHOUT, 

Chairperson. 

PAUL SCALLAN 
Chief Executive. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [204] 

EXPLANATORY MEMORANDUM 

(This note is not part of the instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations extend the Private Security (Licensing and Qualifications) 
Regulations 2022 to enforcement guards in the security sector 

 
 
 
 
 
 [204] 5
